# Uploading PFT Dataframes
```{r}
#Need to import the correct sheet from the original PFF file
outfile1 <- here("MonthlyPM25Data/PFF_FormatData_2021_10_06.xlsx")
FVC <- read_excel(outfile1, sheet="FVC", na="")

DLCO <- read_excel(outfile1, sheet="DLCO", na="")
```

## Correct formatting for FVC dataframe
```{r}
FVC <- FVC %>% dplyr::select(SSID, TestDays, pctFVC)
str(FVC)
```

### Create FVC ID variable
This will make it easier to identify any cells with issues and replace them if needed
```{r}
FVC <- FVC %>% mutate(fvc_id=1:9118)
```

## Correct formatting for DLCO dataframe
```{r}
DLCO <- DLCO %>% dplyr::select(SSID, TestDays, pctDLCOuncorr)
str(DLCO)
```

### Create DLCO ID variable
This will make it easier to identify any cells with issues and replace them if needed
```{r}
DLCO <- DLCO %>% mutate(dlco_id=1:7643)
```



# Uploading PM Dataframe
Need to upload the file which only includes patients with fibrotic ILD
```{r}
outfile2 <- here("Final_PFF_fILD_PM_BaselineData_2022_02_12.xlsx")
PM <- read_excel(outfile2, na="")
```


```{r}
outfile2b <- here("Final_PFF_fILD_PMwarm_BaselineData_2022_02_12.xlsx")
PM_warm <- read_excel(outfile2b, na="")
```

```{r}
outfile2c <- here("Final_PFF_fILD_PMcold_BaselineData_2022_02_12.xlsx")
PM_cold <- read_excel(outfile2c, na="")
```


## Correct date format
```{r}
PM <- PM %>% mutate_at(vars(dx_date, consent_date, censor_date, tx_date, death_date, deathORtx_date, DeathTxCensor_date, sample_date, fvc_date, dlco_date, PM_date), as.Date, format="%m/%d/%Y")
PM_warm <- PM_warm %>% mutate_at(vars(dx_date, consent_date, censor_date, tx_date, death_date, deathORtx_date, DeathTxCensor_date, sample_date, fvc_date, dlco_date, PM_date), as.Date, format="%m/%d/%Y")
PM_cold <- PM_cold %>% mutate_at(vars(dx_date, consent_date, censor_date, tx_date, death_date, deathORtx_date, DeathTxCensor_date, sample_date, fvc_date, dlco_date, PM_date), as.Date, format="%m/%d/%Y")
str(PM)
```

## Correct Factor Variables and Levels
```{r}
PM <- PM %>% mutate_at(vars(status, sex, race, ethnicity, deadORtx, dx, smokeHx, dich_Race, dx_group, dx_IPF, metro, PM5yrCensor_dich, PM5yr_dich), as.factor)
PM_warm <- PM_warm %>% mutate_at(vars(status, sex, race, ethnicity, deadORtx, dx, smokeHx, dich_Race, dx_group, PM5yrCensor_dich, PM5yr_dich), as.factor)
PM_cold <- PM_cold %>% mutate_at(vars(status, sex, race, ethnicity, deadORtx, dx, smokeHx, dich_Race, dx_group, PM5yrCensor_dich, PM5yr_dich), as.factor)
str(PM)
```

## Releveling Factors
Here I am releveling factors so that they are in an intuitive order for my later analyses.
```{r}
PM$sex <- fct_relevel(PM$sex, c("Male","Female"))
PM$race <- fct_relevel(PM$race, c("W","B","A","I","U"))
PM$ethnicity <- fct_relevel(PM$ethnicity, c("N","H","U"))
PM$dich_Race <- fct_relevel(PM$dich_Race, c("White","Non-White"))
PM$smokeHx <- fct_relevel(PM$smokeHx, c("Never"))
PM$PM5yrCensor_dich <- fct_relevel(PM$PM5yrCensor_dich, c("Low", "High"))
PM$PM5yr_dich <- fct_relevel(PM$PM5yr_dich, c("Low", "High"))

#For dx and dx_group, I just want IPF to be first and then the rest of the categories are alphabetical
PM$dx <- fct_relevel(PM$dx, c("IPF"))
PM$dx_group <- fct_relevel(PM$dx_group, c("IPF"))
str(PM)
```

```{r}
PM_warm$sex <- fct_relevel(PM_warm$sex, c("Male","Female"))
PM_warm$race <- fct_relevel(PM_warm$race, c("W","B","A","I","U"))
PM_warm$ethnicity <- fct_relevel(PM_warm$ethnicity, c("N","H","U"))
PM_warm$dich_Race <- fct_relevel(PM_warm$dich_Race, c("White","Non-White"))

PM_warm$PM5yr_dich <- fct_relevel(PM_warm$PM5yr_dich, c("Low", "High"))

#For dx and dx_group, I just want IPF to be first and then the rest of the categories are alphabetical

PM_warm$dx_group <- fct_relevel(PM_warm$dx_group, c("IPF"))
```


# Remove PFTs that occurred >6mo before consent_date
```{r}
pft <-  pft %>% mutate(fvc_timefromcensor=(fvc_date-consent_date)/365.25)
pft$fvc_timefromcensor <-  as.numeric(pft$fvc_timefromcensor)
summary(pft$fvc_timefromcensor)
pft <- pft %>% filter(fvc_timefromcensor>=-0.5)
summary(pft$fvc_timefromcensor)
```
This takes us from  pfts to  pfts

```{r}
pft_warm <-  pft_warm %>% mutate(fvc_timefromcensor=(fvc_date-consent_date)/365.25)
pft_warm$fvc_timefromcensor <-  as.numeric(pft_warm$fvc_timefromcensor)
summary(pft_warm$fvc_timefromcensor)
pft_warm <- pft_warm %>% filter(fvc_timefromcensor>=-0.5)
summary(pft_warm$fvc_timefromcensor)
```

```{r}
pft_cold <-  pft_cold %>% mutate(fvc_timefromcensor=(fvc_date-consent_date)/365.25)
pft_cold$fvc_timefromcensor <-  as.numeric(pft_cold$fvc_timefromcensor)
summary(pft_cold$fvc_timefromcensor)
pft_cold <- pft_cold %>% filter(fvc_timefromcensor>=-0.5)
summary(pft_cold$fvc_timefromcensor)
```

Next need to make dlco_timefromcensor variable
```{r}
pft <-  pft %>% mutate(dlco_timefromcensor=(dlco_date-consent_date)/365.25)
pft$dlco_timefromcensor <-  as.numeric(pft$dlco_timefromcensor)
summary(pft$dlco_timefromcensor)
```
And we can see that there are none that occurred >6mo pre-consent, so no more to exclude.

# Remove PFTs that occurred after transplant
Then will make a simpler dataframe that can be joined to pft
```{r}
txed <- PM %>% filter(status==2) %>% dplyr::select(ID, tx_date)
```
We have  patients out of the  who were transplanted

Next will join txed to pft
```{r}
str(pft)
pft$ID <- as.numeric(pft$ID)
pft <- left_join(pft, txed, by=c("ID", "tx_date"))

#remove all pfts where pft_date>tx_date
pft <- pft %>% filter(is.na(tx_date) | fvc_date<tx_date)
```
pft data frame goes from  to  rows.

## Create dataframe that excludes patients which only had one PFT
```{r}
# Determine how many PFTs each patient has
PFT_number <- pft %>% count(ID)
summary(PFT_number)
# minimum number of PFTs is 1, so we do have some patients that only had one PFT that are included in later analyses

# restrict dataframe to only include patients with one PFT
one_pft <- PFT_number %>% filter(n==1)
#144 patients only had one PFT, so we need to ensure the analyses below remain consistent when we remove patients that only have one PFT

# remove patients with only one PFT
pft_over1 <- pft[!pft$ID %in% one_pft$ID,]
#Now my pft_over1 dataframe drops from 7195 rows to 7051 rows, which is a loss of 144 individuals who only had 1 pft

#Recheck using same methods as above
PFT_number <- pft_over1 %>% count(ID)
summary(PFT_number)
#And we can see that the minimum is now 2
```



# Exploratory Data Analysis
## Visualization of Relationship between PM and FVC Decline
5yrs pre-censoring low vs high
```{r}
#First I need to make a new dataframe that removes the PMdx_quart NAs so they don't show up in the plot
pft1 <- pft %>% filter(!is.na(PM5yrCensor_dich))

#Then I can plot it   
(ggplot(pft1, aes(x=time_firstFVC, y=fvc_pct, group=ID)) +
   geom_line(aes(color=PM5yrCensor_dich), alpha=0.6)+
   xlim(0,5)+
   stat_smooth(aes(group=1))+
   facet_grid(. ~PM5yrCensor_dich)+
   labs(x="Time from First PFT (years)", y="Change in FVC % Predicted", title="Change in FVC % Predicted by Low vs High PM 5yrs Pre-Censoring", color="PM 5yrs \nPre-Censoring")+
   theme(plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5))+
   scale_color_brewer(type="seq", palette="YlOrRd"))
```

## Descriptive Stats for FVC Decline
```{r}
#Look at the mean and total variance of fvc_pct
pft %>% summarise(mean_fvc=mean(fvc_pct, na.rm=T))
tot_var_fvc <- pft %>% dplyr::select(fvc_pct) %>% summarise(var_fvc_pct=var(fvc_pct, na.rm=T))
tot_var_fvc

#Look at the between subject variance
bw_subj_var_fvc <- pft %>% group_by(ID) %>% mutate(mean_fvc_pct=mean(fvc_pct)) %>% ungroup() %>% summarise(bw_subj_var_fvc=var(mean_fvc_pct, na.rm=T))
bw_subj_var_fvc

fvc_ICC <- bw_subj_var_fvc/tot_var_fvc
fvc_ICC
```
fvc_ICC=0.89 indicates that ~89% of the variance is between subject variance. I.e. there is more difference in fvc_pct between patients than within any single patient.

## Number of PFTs
```{r}

n_pfts
summary(n_pfts$n)
```
This shows that the median # of PFTs is 5 and the mean is 6 (similar to Simmons)

# Pre/Post-2015 - Association between PM 5yrs Pre-Diagnosis and FVC Decline
Linear mixed models with random intercept and slope will be used to evaluate the impact of PM During Disease on FVC decline.

## Pre/Post-2015 - Continuous PM 5yrs Pre-Diagnosis and FVC Models with Random Intercept and Random Slope
### Pre/Post-2015 - Base Model
```{r}
FVC_lmer1a <- lmer(fvc_pct ~ 1 + time_firstFVC*PM_5yrPreDx + (1 + time_firstFVC| ID), data=pre2015)
summary(FVC_lmer1a)
icc(FVC_lmer1a)
report(FVC_lmer1a)
```

```{r}
FVC_lmer1b <- lmer(fvc_pct ~ 1 + time_firstFVC*PM_5yrPreDx + (1 + time_firstFVC| ID), data=post2015)
summary(FVC_lmer1b)
icc(FVC_lmer1b)
report(FVC_lmer1b)
```

### Pre/Post-2015 - Complete Model
```{r}
FVC_lmer2a <- lmer(fvc_pct ~ 1 + time_firstFVC*PM_5yrPreDx + time_firstFVC*dich_Race + time_firstFVC*sex + time_firstFVC*age_dx + time_firstFVC*smokeHx + time_firstFVC*pct_belowpoverty + time_firstFVC*site +(1 + time_firstFVC| ID), data=pre2015)
summary(FVC_lmer2a)
icc(FVC_lmer2a)
report(FVC_lmer2a)
```

```{r}
FVC_lmer2b <- lmer(fvc_pct ~ 1 + time_firstFVC*PM_5yrPreDx + time_firstFVC*dich_Race + time_firstFVC*sex + time_firstFVC*age_dx + time_firstFVC*smokeHx + time_firstFVC*pct_belowpoverty + time_firstFVC*site +(1 + time_firstFVC| ID), data=post2015)
summary(FVC_lmer2b)
icc(FVC_lmer2b)
report(FVC_lmer2b)
```
